definition: to feel attached to/to long for/to love

sentences.english: They say the nightingale pierces his bosom with a thorn when he sings his love song.
sentences.chinese: 他們說夜鶯唱出戀歌時，用荊棘刺穿自己的胸膛。

sentences.english: I am willing to total spectrum lasting love song.
sentences.chinese: 我願與你共譜矢志不移的戀歌。

sentences.english: His poetry collection The Love Song for Mountains was awarded The First National Outstanding New Poetry Prize.
sentences.chinese: 其中詩集《山的戀歌》獲第一屆全國優秀新詩獎。

sentences.english: Caressing your cascading long hair, singing a love song in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 把你那如瀑的長髮輕輕撩動，爲你唱一曲風的戀歌。

sentences.english: They said that when the Nightingale sang Love Song to stab himself headlong into the heart chamber.
sentences.chinese: 他們說夜鶯唱着戀歌的時候，把刺扎進自己的心膛。

sentences.english: After "Winter Love Song" he advanced to the movie world in Korea.
sentences.chinese: 在《冬季戀歌》之後，他朝著韓國電影界進軍。

definition: (of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
lit. flowers in a mirror and the moon reflected in the lake (idiom)/fig. an unrealistic rosy view/viewing things through rose-tinted spectacles/also written 水月鏡花|水月镜花
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
doubly homesick for our dear ones at each festive day (from a poem by Wang Wei 王維|王维[Wang2 Wei2])
pinyin: mei3 feng2 jia1 jie2 bei4 si1 qin1
